channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024070077
item.description:
Report E-2024070077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: WALCOTT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at the end of the day and was doing post-trip and saw moisture on the bottom of the trailer nothing was dripping but driver put down absorbent cloth just in case. The driver then called the emergency number at 2000ET. W crew was the dispatched and arrived at 1000ET. The discovered the the cap on the top of the tote was not secured properly and they fixed the cap. They then wiped up any residue that had come out approximately 2 cups and disposed of the material per the regulations. The clean up was completed at 1100ET.

item.title: Report X-2024070249
item.description:
Report X-2024070249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: ANKENY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A wrapped pallet of pails had been sitting on the dock in bay 1 at SC 102. Other freight was unloaded and stored around the pallet of pails. It was discovered that some of the freight was pushed into the pallet of pails, causing one of the pails to become punctured and slowly ooze out adhesive.

item.title: Report E-2024070036
item.description:
Report E-2024070036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: UNDERWOOD
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest area to take a break and to check on his load. When the driver walked around he noticed a drip coming from his trailer onto the drive tire he then though down some absorbent. The driver than called our emergency response line and a team was dispatched out at approximately 0845. The crew arrived at 1100 to investigate they found 3 drums that the lids were not secured tightly. The then unloaded the trailer to gain access to the containers wiping up any residue on the floor as they went. The 3 drums lids and rings were then tightened securely. The absorbents used to clean up the residue were then disposed of properly. The crew was done at 1700.
